column4: hello.  using ubuntu 11.10... still trying to mount cdrom... slowly figuring it out... now when i try to mount using gmount i get "pixmap error."  time to go back to pencil and paper  :-)  any ideas?
your cdrom doesnt mount automatically when you insert the disc?
do you have a cdrom that you absolutely know works? not damage?
in terminal, what does this say "ls /dev/cd*
hmm, I think this should try and mount it "sudo mount /dev/cdrom /mnt"
well then do "cd /mnt" and then "ls" to see whats there
then there is probably a driver issue with your cdrom drive (at least it indicates that) or a program with the actual drive (physically)
did you install from scratch (alternate cd) or through a livecd?
lol right, but was it through a LiveCD (where you had a fully functioning Ubuntu loaded) or through the older text menu driven installer?
hmm, then I might seek a second opinion for troubleshooting, because the drive shouldnt have an issue wiht drivers if you used the livecd
it should, or  a box to ask you what you want to do. but if it gives you an input/output error that's not good
is there a disc or cd image on your desktop?
yeah, like something that would indicate a disc in the drive on your desktop (icon)
probably repeat the command with "sudo" in front
oh wait, it should show you permissions (sorry brain fart)
& Ben64, thx for the help... it is appreciated.
np bud, wish I could have helped more (been saying that a lot tonight)
